meanings.definition: To make or become longer in distance.
meanings.sent1: I used a ruler to lengthen the line on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The road crew worked hard to lengthen the highway.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to lengthen the scarf, but it kept getting shorter!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to lengthen the distance between them.
meanings.sent5: The shadows of the trees lengthen as the sun sets.

meanings.definition: To extend in time or duration.
meanings.sent1: Can you lengthen the meeting by another hour?
meanings.sent2: The movie director decided to lengthen the final scene.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to lengthen the test by asking many questions.
meanings.sent4: His patience seemed to lengthen as the conversation continued.
meanings.sent5: The suspense in the room seemed to lengthen with each passing minute.
